snippet: The British energy minister is expected to approve the country’s first new nuclear power plant in two decades, though it is already four years behind schedule.
abstract: British government is expected to approve country’s first new nuclear power plant in two decades, though it is already four years behind schedule.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: The British energy minister is expected to approve the country’s first new nuclear power plant in two decades, though it is already four years behind schedule.

headline.seo: Britain’s Plans for Nuclear Power Plant Reach a Decisive Point
headline.main: Britain’s Plans for New Nuclear Plant Approach a Decisive Point, 4 Years Late
headline.print_headline: Britain’s Plans for New Nuclear Plant Approach a Decisive Point, 4 Years Late
